learning_objectives.objective: Define key terms: backup expiration, Recovery Point Objective (RPO), Recovery Time Objective (RTO), retention schedule, and media sanitization methods (Clear, Purge, Destroy) from NIST SP 800-88.
List the three primary media sanitization techniques and their purposes.
Explain the relationship between backup retention schedules, RPO/RTO, and compliance requirements (e.g., HIPAA 6-year retention).
Apply retention tiers to classify data for a given organization (e.g., assign short-term operational backups vs. long-term archival).
Compare Clear, Purge, and Destroy media sanitization methods, including their threats mitigated and use cases.
Evaluate the trade-offs of extended backup retention (compliance benefits) vs. risks (e.g., ransomware exposure from old backups), justifying a policy recommendation.
Design a comprehensive backup expiration and deletion policy for a fictional bank, incorporating retention schedules, deletion methods, automation, and regulatory compliance.
